filteredArticles.headline: Rev. Al Sharpton calls for minority representation, transparency in management of endowment
filteredArticles.abstract: Sharpton asked Gutmann to publish a report on the involvement of African American professionals in the management of Penn’s $14.7 billion endowment.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn reports endowment return rate as 6.5% – a drop from 12.9% last year

dominantMedia.title: Al Sharpton.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Activist Reverend Al Sharpton is president of National Action Network, which is calling for universities to be more transparent in the demographic data of their asset managers. (Photo by Gerard Flynn | CC BY 2.0)

filteredArticles.headline: U. minority group leaders continue providing community support, resources during pandemic
filteredArticles.abstract: The leaders said their current priority is ensuring the well-being of community members since most students are currently living away from campus.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: 6B Leaders.jpg
dominantMedia.content: The 6B leaders are top row (from left to right): Martha Gakunju and Derek Nuamah of UMOJA, Sarah Kim of APSC. Middle row (from left to right): Bryce Nguyen of Lambda Alliance, Frances Paulino of Latinx Coalition. Bottom row (from left to right): Angela Yang of PAGE, Brooke Price of UMC.

filteredArticles.headline: CAFSA cuts ties with Penn Dems after it endorsed Biden, who faces sexual assault allegation
filteredArticles.abstract: CAFSA, an on-campus organization officially founded in September 2019 to combat rape culture and support historically underrepresented identities, removed Penn Dems from their coalition after they endorsed presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Biden's claim of being a 'teacher' at Penn drew scrutiny. Here's what his role really was.

With Sanders out, Penn Dems and Penn for Biden move to unite young voters

Penn Dems and Penn for Bernie urge investigation into Biden sexual assault allegation

filteredArticles.headline: Bloomers members reflect on stereotypes against women in comedy amid spring show
filteredArticles.abstract: Bloomers cast members said although the group is becoming increasingly popular on campus, as women, they often have to work harder and be smarter than men to put on a successful show.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn's OWN IT summit shifts focus from leadership to gender equality and inclusion

dominantMedia.title: Bloomers Spring 2020 002.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Several members of the Bloomers cast including Amanda Bello (left), Morgan Singer, Hope Brindle, Alex Goldstein, and Alison Yarto (right) perform a bit as part of the Bloomers spring show.

filteredArticles.headline: Makuu celebrates 20 years as Penn’s Black cultural center
filteredArticles.abstract: Makuu opened in fall 2000 as a resource center for Penn students interested in Black culture and the African Diaspora under the Vice Provost for University Life.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

filteredArticles.headline: Penn Monologues will replace annual Vagina Monologues event to promote inclusivity
filteredArticles.abstract: Penn V-Day's board, also known as V-Board, decided to replace the Vagina Monologues in Spring 2018 to showcase a more inclusive production not centered around the female anatomy.

dominantMedia.title: penn monologues.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Penn Monologues will be a more inclusive production that doesn’t center around the cis female experience.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn Women's Center strives for inclusivity one year into new director's role
filteredArticles.abstract: Director of the Penn Women’s Center Sherisse Laud-Hammond said that the number of events, meetings, classes, and tours held at PWC has increased from 292 to 382 in the past year.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Sherisse Laud-Hammond
dominantMedia.content: Sherisse Laud-Hammond just finished her first year as the director of the Penn Women's Center.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn added over 50 lactation spaces across campus in the last decade
filteredArticles.abstract: Penn Women's Center Director Sherisse Laud-Hammond said that the number of free breast pump attachment kits distributed by Penn Women’s Center through their Pump-Kit Giveaway Program has also nearly tripled in the past three years.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Lactation Spaces 002.jpg
dominantMedia.content: The lactation room at Penn Women's Center is private, with comfortable seating and a hospital grade breast pump.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn is adding more gender inclusive bathrooms, but students say there is still work to do
filteredArticles.abstract: The Office of the University Architect is currently working to add gender inclusive bathrooms in David Rittenhouse Laboratories and Levine building, according to a statement from University Architect Mark Kocent. Houston Hall will undergo similar renovations in summer 2020.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

filteredArticles.headline: Meet the new leaders of the 6B, Penn’s main minority coalitions
filteredArticles.abstract: The 6B consists of the Asian Pacific Student Coalition, Lambda Alliance, Latinx Coalition, Penn Association for Gender Equity, the United Minorities Council, and UMOJA.

filteredArticles.headline: UA drafts proposal to provide free chest binders for transgender students
filteredArticles.abstract: College Junior and UA Representative Cam Duran said the initiative was inspired by a program offered at Cornell University in which students enrolled in a Cornell student health plan or who pay the Student Health Fee can receive up to two chest binders each semester with no copayment.
filteredArticles.infobox:
